articles.description: SUTHERLIN — Sutherlin has a chronic shortage of affordable housing for teachers, nurses and other middle-income workers. On Monday, Sutherlin City Council agreed to create a housing and homeless task force to come up with ideas, and ultimately possible solutions,…
articles.title: Sutherlin to launch housing and homeless task force

articles.description: Shopping local means fresh fuel for your body and spending money within your community, at least that’s what it means for Umpqua Valley Farmers' Market Manager Meg Williams.

articles.description:
SALEM, Ore. — The Compliance Monitoring Program Committee will hold a virtual meeting Thursday, Jan. 18, from 9 to 11 a.m. To join virtually, please use the Zoom video conference information found on the agenda.
The committee’s agenda includes:

CMP Long term outlook
Follow-up items from previous meeting
Long term study – Riparian rule selection discussion

The meeting is open to the public to attend online via Zoom. Requests for an interpreter for the hearing impaired or other accommodations for persons with disabilities should be made at least 48 hours before the meeting by emailing adam.coble@odf.oregon.gov.
The CMP Committee assists efforts to monitor compliance with Forest Practices Rules. The committee advises ODF regarding monitoring projects and procedures. View more information on the CMPC webpage.
articles.title: Compliance Monitoring Program Committee meets Jan. 18

articles.description:
SALEM, Ore. — The Committee for Family Forestlands will meet virtually on Thursday, Jan. 11 from 9 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. To join virtually, please use the Zoom video conference information found on the agenda. 
The committee’s agenda includes:

Forest Resources Division update
Small Forestland Owner Office update
Private Forest Accord update
Board of Forestry update
Adaptive Management Program Committee review
Agenda topics and meeting schedule discussion

The meeting is open to the public to attend online via Zoom. Public comments will be accepted near the start of the meeting. Requests for an interpreter for the hearing impaired or other accommodations for persons with disabilities should be made at least 24 hours before the meeting by emailing committee.of.family.forestlands@odf.oregon.gov.
The 13-member committee researches policies that affect family forests, natural resources and forestry benefits. Based on its findings, the committee recommends actions to the Oregon Board of Forestry and the State Forester. View more information on the CFF webpage.
articles.title: Committee for Family Forestlands meets Jan. 11
